task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 103°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To view the full height of the main building, I need to look up to see the roof section since the current view only shows the lower part; rotating the camera up by 30 degrees will help capture the upper structure.
My current heading is 0°N, but the target building is to the East (approx 103°), so I need to rotate right by 103 degrees to face the target building again to continue assessing its height.

Since the current view only shows the lower portion of the target building, I need to look up by 30 degrees to visualize the upper structure and roof, which is necessary to estimate the full height from ground to roof.
I'm currently facing North (0°), but the target building is to the East (103°), so I need to rotate right by 103 degrees to reorient toward the target building and continue assessing its full height.

To view the full height of the target building, I need to look up to see the roof section, so I will rotate the camera up by 30 degrees while maintaining the current heading toward the East-facing building.
To correctly face the East target building (103°) and look up at its roof to assess full height, I'll perform a custom rotation to set heading to 103° and pitch to 30°.

Now that I can see the full height of the target building, I estimate its height to be 24 meters, as it appears to have 8 residential-style floors each approximately 3 meters tall, plus a small roof structure.
